an10.2:1.1: “Mendicants, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethical conduct, need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.3: It’s only natural that an ethical person has no regrets.
an10.2:1.4: When you have no regrets you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.6: It’s only natural that joy springs up when you have no regrets.
an10.2:1.7: When you feel joy you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.9: It’s only natural that rapture arises when you’re joyful.
an10.2:1.10: When your mind is full of rapture you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.12: It’s only natural that your body becomes tranquil when your mind is full of rapture.
an10.2:1.13: When your body is tranquil you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.15: It’s only natural to feel bliss when your body is tranquil.
an10.2:1.16: When you feel bliss you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.17: ‘May my mind be immersed in samādhi!’
an10.2:1.18: It’s only natural for the mind to be immersed in samādhi when you feel bliss.
an10.2:1.19: When your mind is immersed in samādhi you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.21: It’s only natural to truly know and see when your mind is immersed in samādhi.
an10.2:1.22: When you truly know and see you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.24: It’s only natural to become disillusioned and dispassionate when you truly know and see.
an10.2:1.25: When you’re disillusioned and dispassionate you need not make a wish:
an10.2:1.26: ‘May I realize the knowledge and vision of freedom!’
an10.2:1.27: It’s only natural to realize the knowledge and vision of freedom when you’re disillusioned and dispassionate.
an10.2:2.1: And so, mendicants, the knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.2:2.2: Disillusionment and dispassion is the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing.
an10.2:2.3: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of immersion.
an10.2:2.4: Immersion is the purpose and benefit of bliss.
an10.2:2.5: Bliss is the purpose and benefit of tranquility.
an10.2:2.6: Tranquility is the purpose and benefit of rapture.
an10.2:2.7: Rapture is the purpose and benefit of joy.
an10.2:2.8: Joy is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.
an10.2:2.9: Not having regrets is the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics.
an10.2:2.10: And so, mendicants, good qualities flow on and fill up from one to the other, for going from the near shore to the far shore.”
